description.narrative: Support to Security and Justice Sector Governance in Post-conflict Iraq.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output indicator 2.1c: # of small grants provided to civil society organizations to undertake local level initiatives to improve public-police collaboration
This output indicator is the third of three indicators related to output 2: Law enforcement and criminal justice capacities of targeted institutions in Iraq strengthened

target.value: 12 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/police and other security and justice service providers at local level

actual.value: 12 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to improve public - police / security and justice service provision partneships at local level.

target.value: 15 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/police and other security and justice service providers at local level

actual.value: 12 low value grants were awarded to 6 iraqi civil society organisations and 12 quick impact projects were implemented in Anbar, Basra, Ninewa, Salah al-Din, Baghdad and Karbala.

target.value: 20 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/police and other security and justice service providers at local level

actual.value: Awarded 13 low value grants worth USD 127,958 to 11 local CSOs and implemented 13 quick impact projects to improve local safety and community-police partnerships in Baghdad, Karbala, Basra, Anbar, Salah-al-Din, and Ninewa. Out of all applicants, only 13 CSOs met the UNDP criteria for the low value grants.

title.narrative: Output indicator 2.1b: # of police Officers trained against prioritized training requirements in target locations (gender disaggregated)
This output indicator is the second of three indicators related to output 2: Law enforcement and criminal justice capacities of targeted institutions in Iraq strengthened

target.value: 500 local police officers trained and mentored on improving effectiveness of local police (IELP)

actual.value: 166 midranking local police officers were trained and mentored on Improving Effectiveness of Local Police (IELP) and Police Midlevel Management Course (160 men and 6 women).

target.value: 1000 local police officers trained and mentored on improving effectiveness of local police (IELP)

actual.value: In total 1,032 (12 women) officers have been trained via both direct and cascade basic and TOT trainings on crime prevention, criminal investigations, police management, homicide investigations, and suspect interviewing.

target.value: 700 local police officers trained and mentored on improving effectiveness of local police (IELP) and mid level police training

actual.value: Total of 43 Local Police Officers trained using virtual training modalities (40 men and 3 women). Three IELP training courses composed of one week course duration each with similar sized classes 13-14 participants.

title.narrative: 1. Proportion of population satisfied with their last experience of public services (disaggregated by services from the security and criminal justice sector)

In order to reach this outcome, the following two outputs must be met:
Output 1: Strategic Advisory coordination and capacity development support provided to strengthen security sector governance
Output 2: Law enforcement and criminal justice capacities of targeted institutions in Iraq strengthened
Output indicator 2.1a: Local Police Service Road Map developed and implemented
This output indicator is the first of three indicators related to output 2: Law enforcement and criminal justice capacities of targeted institutions in Iraq strengthened

target.value: The Road Map is operational with at least 4 out of 6 Road Map Core functions fully operational.

actual.value: Road Map and its 6 core functions are being implemented within MoI 2020 annual work plan corresponding to ts organisational 5 year strategic plan.

target.value: Implementation of the Road map initiated with at least 2 out of 6 Road Map Core Police functions fully operational

actual.value: Road Map is implemented with 2 out of the 6 core functions fully operational: Improving Effectiveness of Local Police (IELP) and Community Policing. Additionally. the Road Map is also noted as one of the key reference documents in the recently endorsed MoI 5 Year Strategy ( 2019- 2023).

target.value: The Roas Map is continued to be operational with all 6 core Police Functions of the Road Map fully operational.

actual.value: The Local Police Service Road Map and its 6 core functions are being implemented in accordance with the MoI Five-year Strategic Plan (2019 -2023).

title.narrative: Output indicator(s) 1: i) types of technical advisory support provided by UNDP to the government of Iraq on Security Sector Reform Programme (SSRP) implementation; and, ii) feedback on the technical advisory support provided from relevant stakeholders
This output indicator related to the output 1: Strategic Advisory coordination and capacity development support provided to strengthen security sector governance

target.value: SSRP implemenation mechanism consisting of 7 systems of which 6 are fully operational

actual.value: Out of the 8 systems, 7 and the cross-cutting system on women in SSR are fully operational with work in progress on identified stratgies/policies and recommendations.

target.value: SSRP implementation mechanism consisting of 7 systems of which 4 are fully operational

actual.value: SSRP implementation mechanism consisting 8 systems of which 5 are fully operational

target.value: SSRP implementation mechanism consisting of 7 systems of which 7 are fully operational

actual.value: Seven out of the eight system priorities of the SSRP and its cross-cutting system on women in SSR are being implemented, and this work is ongoing.
